com.ibm.iotf.client.device

Class DeviceClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.iotf.client.AbstractClient
      • com.ibm.iotf.client.device.DeviceClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttCallback

    public class DeviceClient
extends AbstractClient
implements org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttCallback
    A client, used by device, that handles connections with the IBM Internet of Things Foundation.
    This is a derived class from AbstractClient and can be used by embedded devices to handle connections with IBM Internet of Things Foundation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeviceClient(java.util.Properties options)
      Create a device client for the IBM Internet of Things Foundation.

      • publishEvent

        public boolean publishEvent(java.lang.String event,
                   java.lang.Object data)
        Publish data to the IBM Internet of Things Foundation.
        Note that data is published at Quality of Service (QoS) 0, which means that a successful send does not guarantee receipt even if the publish has been successful.
        Parameters:
        event - Name of the dataset under which to publish the data
        data - Object to be added to the payload as the dataset
        Returns:
        Whether the send was successful.

      • publishEvent

        public boolean publishEvent(java.lang.String event,
                   java.lang.Object data,
                   int qos)
        Publish data to the IBM Internet of Things Foundation.
        This method allows QoS to be passed as an argument
        Parameters:
        event - Name of the dataset under which to publish the data
        data - Object to be added to the payload as the dataset
        qos - Quality of Service - should be 0, 1 or 2
        Returns:
        Whether the send was successful.

      • connectionLost

        public void connectionLost(java.lang.Throwable exception)
        If we lose connection trigger the connect logic to attempt to reconnect to the IBM Internet of Things Foundation.
        Specified by:
        connectionLost in interface org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttCallback
        Parameters:
        exception - Throwable which caused the connection to get lost

      • deliveryComplete

        public void deliveryComplete(org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.IMqttDeliveryToken token)
        A completed deliver does not guarantee that the message is received by the service because devices send messages with Quality of Service (QoS) 0.
        The message count represents the number of messages that were sent by the device without an error on from the perspective of the device.
        Specified by:
        deliveryComplete in interface org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttCallback
        Parameters:
        token - MQTT delivery token
